channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The planet is getting hotter fast. This is what happens to your body in extreme heat
item.description: Human-caused climate change has already made heat waves around the world more frequent and intense.

item.title: 5 things to watch in the first 2024 general election debate
item.description: President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump will face off in-person Thursday for the first of two presidential debates this year.

item.title: China rejects U.S. envoy's comment that it hinders people-to-people exchanges
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Biden pardoning LGBTQ+ service members convicted for sexual orientation
item.description: The pardon could affect thousands of service members convicted over the six decades that military law formally banned consensual homosexual conduct.

item.title: The Juneteenth flag is full of symbols. Here's what they mean
item.description: Designing the Juneteenth flag was a deliberate process, says creator Ben Haith, who breaks down what each element of the flag represents.

item.title: NATO appoints outgoing Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte as its next secretary-general
item.description: NATO has appointed Mark Rutte as its next secretary-general, putting the outgoing Dutch prime minister in charge of the worldâ€™s biggest security organization at a critical time for European security as war rages in Ukraine

item.title: Republican Jeff Hurd beats election denier boosted by Democrats in race for Boebert seat
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich's trial starts in Russia
item.description: Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich went on trial behind closed doors in Russia on espionage charges he, the Journal and Washington vehemently deny. A conviction is considered almost certain.

item.title: June 18 2024: US heat wave news
item.description: A dangerous heat wave is scorching parts of the Midwest and Northeast. Record-breaking high temperatures are forecast across dozens of cities where cooling centers have been opened to protect the vulnerable.

item.title: Reporter Evan Gershkovich arrives in Russian court for secret espionage trial
item.description: The case against the journalist has been widely denounced by U.S. officials and press-freedom advocates, along with Gershkovich's editor and publisher.

item.title: Jamaal Bowman becomes first member of the 'Squad' to lose 2024 primary as Democrats divide over Israel
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Latimer wins NY-16 primary, CBS News projects, beating incumbent Bowman
item.description: CBS News projects George Latimer has won the closely watched Democratic Primary Election in New York's 16th Congressional District, beating incumbent Jamaal Bowman.

item.title: 'I know it happens': Boeing chief admits the company has retaliated against whistleblowers
item.description: The outgoing chief of the embattled airplane maker is testifying in the wake of a whistleblower's allegations of safety issues.

item.title: Hollywood crews, studios reach tentative contract deal
item.description: The union that represents most behind-the-scenes film and television crews has reached a tentative deal with studios for about 50,000 of its members, making another production-stopping strike unlikely after a year of labor turmoil in Hollywood

item.title: Man who diverted national park river to ease boat access to Lake Michigan is put on probation
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Boebert wins crowded House GOP primary in new Colorado district
item.description: Republican Rep. Lauren Boebert declared victory on Tuesday night in the primary election in her new Colorado district.

item.title: June 17, 2024 - Israel-Gaza news
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has disbanded the country's war cabinet, an Israeli official says, just over a week after opposition leader Benny Gantz withdrew from the body.

item.title: New York, Colorado and Utah primaries 2024: Bowman loses, Boebert wins
item.description: 538 live-blogged updates on New York, Colorado, Utah and South Carolina primary elections and runoffs for U.S. Senate, U.S. House and governor.

item.title: Evacuations, road closures lifted as crews work to douse brush fire in Del Mar Heights
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Debate in Washington, D.C., brews over U.S. alcohol guidelines
item.description: A battle is brewing in Washington, D.C., over America's alcohol guidelines. Julie Wernau, reporter for The Wall Street Journal, joins CBS News to explain what some of the proposed changes might look like and how they could affect your daily pour.
